Chennai.intro: Where ancient Dravidian shrines stand beside a roaring ocean and colonial avenues — spirituality in a modern metropolis.

temples.name: Kapaleeshwarar Temple
temples.significance: Built by Pallavas; famous for divine peacock legend and Dravidian gopuram.

temples.name: Parthasarathy Temple
temples.significance: Oldest known Krishna temple; deity appears with conch marks and moustache.

temples.name: Ashtalakshmi Temple
temples.significance: Eight forms of Goddess Lakshmi worshipped in one sacred complex by the sea.

Kanchipuram.intro: City of a thousand temples — philosophical capital of the Pallavas and seat of Sri Kamakoti Peetam.

temples.name: Ekambareswarar Temple
temples.significance: Sacred mango tree believed to be 3,500 years old; Pallava origin.

temples.name: Kamakshi Amman Temple
temples.significance: Goddess seated posture represents supreme grace and compassion.

temples.name: Varadaraja Perumal Temple
temples.significance: Golden lizard shrine; major Vishnu Kshetram.

Thanjavur.intro: Imperial Chola heartland — where granite rose like mountain peaks to honour the divine.

temples.name: Brihadeeswarar Temple
temples.significance: Rajaraja Chola’s masterpiece — the Great Living Chola Temple.
